poem:
**Free Birth Society**

In hushed rooms, a whispering tide,  
Mothers turn to the moon, not the clock—  
Midwives traded for midnight's guide,  
In whispers of stars, they unlock—  
Courage in skin's quiet embers,  
The threads of stories untold,  
As dreams cradle and hold  
Their breath, until truth remembers.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Five key findings from our investigation into the Free Birth Society The Free Birth Society (FBS) is a business run from North Carolina that promotes the idea of women giving birth without midwives or doctors present. It is led by Emilee Saldaya and Yolande Norris-Clark, ex-doulas turned social media influencers who have gained a global following through the FBS podcast, which has been downloaded millions of times. FBS profits from sales of its instructional video". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Five key findings from our investigation into the Free Birth Society The Free Birth Society (FBS) is a business run from North Carolina that promotes the idea of women giving birth without midwives or doctors present. It is led by Emilee Saldaya and Yolande Norris-Clark, ex-doulas turned social media influencers who have gained a global following through the FBS podcast, which has been downloaded millions of times. FBS profits from sales of its instructional video
